DOC.brief_summary: This human dietary intervention study cross-over design aim investigate effect two different diurnal pattern meal composition peripheral circadian clock energy metabolism healthy men .
DOC.brief_title: The CLOCK Study - A Human Dietary Intervention Study Peripheral Circadian Clocks Energy Metabolism
DOC.detailed_description: In cross-over study , healthy male participant randomly allocate one two study group : In study group ( A ) participant consume isocaloric carbohydrate-rich meal ( 65 % Carbohydrates ; 20 % Fat ; 15 % Protein ) morning fat-rich meal ( 35 % Carbohydrate ; 50 % Fat ; 15 % Protein ) even four week . After washout-phase participant consume isocaloric fat-rich meal morning carbohydrate-rich meal even another four week . Study group ( B ) receive intervention reverse order .
DOC.criteria: BMI 22 kg/m² 34,9 kg/m² Normal glucose tolerance determine 75goral glucose tolerance test Impaired fast glucose determine 75goral glucose tolerance test Impaired glucose tolerance determine 75goral glucose tolerance test Shift worker history shift work Men suffer disease condition might influence outcome study . Of special interest disease influence body weight regulation ( enteropathy , malabsorption , hepatopathy , renal disease , endocrine disorder , diabetes mellitus , eat disorder , heart disease etc. ) . Also men suffer coagulopathy , apoplexy myocardial infarction exclude study . Men suffer psychiatric disease Planned change physical activity study Participation clinical study within last three month Weight change > 2 kg within 2 month prior screen day Men unable give inform consent Men unable engage dietary intervention Men follow special diet
